post.description: This endpoint generates a new jwt manage token. It requires an admin manage token to be used

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: scope requested for the token (default: config)

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: number of minute before the token expiration (0 for token that won't expire unless the client application is deleted) (default: 1)

post.summary: Login with credentials and set as cookie

expires_in.description: duration in seconds of the token validity

auth_token.description: new token created for the new anonymous user

post.description:
This endpoint creates a new temporary token related to a new anonymous user.

It will expire 30 minutes after.

Note: if you supply client_id and client_secret, or if you call this endpoint with the manage_token, the token will be permanent.

payload.description: the payload contained in the jwt token

post.description: This endpoint generates a new jwt token for the user. This token will last the time in minutes given by the config key auth.default_token_expire (permanent if this the parameter expire=False is given)

parameters.name: id_user
parameters.description: user for whom the token has to be generated. If not supplied, a user will be created

parameters.name: expire
parameters.description: if set to True, the token will expire n minutes after its creation, n being the value of configuration key auth.default_token_expire (default: True)

post.description: Create a new user with his email address and password.

parameters.name: notification_token
parameters.description: APNS or GCM token to send notifications to device

post.description: Sent token can be re-generated as it might be expired. Note that requesting email confirmation on already confirmed profile will raise a BadRequest.
post.summary: Resend an email to confirm email address.

expires_in.description: duration in seconds of the token validity

post.description: Request a new user token by giving an username and a password.

delete.description: This endpoint removes the token in use.

access_token.description: the access token transformed from the temporary one

post.description: In order to register a new user with the OAuth 2 process, the client has to call this endpoint to request a granted access_token with the received temporary code.
post.summary: Transform a temporary code to a access_token

expires_in.description: duration in seconds of the token validity

get.description:
This endpoint generates a new temporary token for the user.

In case the access_token is used by a trusted device, and you want to let another one (for example a web browser) access to user resources, use this service to create a token which will expire in 30 minutes.

If the keyword already exists the keyword is not added. Used for the categorization of transactions.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a connector logo. You can either pass a file to as a parameter to insert and link it with the connector or pass an id_file to link a connector with an existing file. Will fail if the file is already linked with that connector.

Form params: - id_file (integer): The id of the file to link with that connector. - img (string): Path to the image to link with that connector.

put.description:
This endpoint creates or update a connector logo. This logo is a mapping between a file (/file route) and a connector (/connectors route) or a provider (/providers route).

Form params: - id_file (integer): The id of the file to link with that connector.
put.summary: Create or Update a connector Logo

get.description:
You can get all the invoicing data or just specific ones by using the available parameters.

If no parameters are specified, no invoicing data is returned.

parameters.name: users_synced
parameters.description: the number of user synchronized during the period

parameters.description: the number of user of the Bank API synchronized during the period

parameters.name: users_bill
parameters.description: the number of user of the Bill API synchronized during the period

parameters.name: accounts_synced
parameters.description: the number of accounts synchronized during the period

parameters.name: subscriptions_synced
parameters.description: the number of subscriptions synchronized during the period

parameters.name: connections_synced
parameters.description: the number of connections synchronized during the period

parameters.name: connections_account
parameters.description: the number of Bank API connections synchronized during the period

parameters.name: transfers_synced
parameters.description: the number of transfers done during the period

parameters.description: get all the invoicing data at once

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: get full ids list instead of numbers

get.description:
Get balance (income/outcome/balance) of enabled accounts for the given period.

By default, min_date and max_date are the current month, and period is a single month.

The period is composed with units (days, months, years) and numbers. You can give for example "1month", "15days", "1year6months", etc.

parameters.description: split output with the given period (default: month)

parameters.description: date on which the transaction has been found for the first time. YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(default: now)

parameters.description: account of the transaction. If not supplied, it has to be given in the route

parameters.description: change application date of the transaction

parameters.description: if false, transaction isn't considered in analyzisis endpoints (like /balances)

parameters.description: second threshold from which an alert has to be sent for a low balance

parameters.description: if false, the alert is not taken into account

post.description:
Give new parameters to change on the configuration of this connection (for example "password").

It tests connection to website, and if it fails, a 400 response is given with the error code "wrongpass" or "websiteUnavailable".

You can also supply meta-parameters on connection, like 'active' or 'expire'.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Set if the connection synchronisation is active

parameters.name: expire
parameters.description: Set expiration of the connection to this date

parameters.name: login
parameters.description: Set login to this new login

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Set password to this new password

parameters.name: decoupled
parameters.description: Try to update a connection with the decoupled error

post.description: Create transactions for the supplied account or the account whose id is given with form parameters. It requires an array of transaction dictionaries.

parameters.name: rdate
parameters.description: realisation date of the transaction (default: value of date)

parameters.name: coming
parameters.description: 1 if the transaction has already been debited (default: 0)

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: 1 if the transaction should be taken into account by pfm services (default: 1)

parameters.name: date_scraped
parameters.description: date on which the transaction has been found for the first time. YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS(default: now)

parameters.name: id_account
parameters.description: account of the transaction. If not supplied, it has to be given in the route

parameters.name: application_date
parameters.description: change application date of the transaction

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: if false, transaction isn't considered in analyzisis endpoints (like /balances)

get.summary: Get a list of configurated alerts

parameters.description: whether the threshold is given in absolut value or percent. accepted: percent, flat

parameters.description: (number of days) range on which the analysis has to be done

get.description:
The route encapsulate 2 functionalities: 1. Create or update a connection through oAuth2 session.

2. Execute a transfer through OAuth2 session.

parameters.name: connector_uuid
parameters.description: Optional unique ID of the connector (replaces id_connector)

parameters.name: id_connection
parameters.description: Optional already existing connection to update

get.summary: First step to establish an oAuth2 connection.

parameters.name: id_user
parameters.description: The user ID to associate with the webhook

parameters.name: id_service
parameters.description: The service ID to associate with the webhook

parameters.name: id_auth
parameters.description: The webhook authentication process to use (its ID or its name)

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The webhook parameters as an object with three keys: type, key and value

delete.description: Updates the deleted field with the date of the deletion

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the authentication process (oauth, certificate, token, etc...)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the authentication process to differentiate

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The authentication process configuration. A dict contains either the certificate

post.description: For each parameter, a value will be added in the webhook data. Use the key to set the name of the field. The values that can be added are to be found in the user configuration.
post.summary: Setup a field to store in user config when calling the endpoint

get.summary: retrieve the value to add in the requested webhook for the requested name

post.description: For each parameter, a value will be added in the webhook data. Use the key to set the name of the field. The values that can be added are to be found in the user configuration.
post.summary: upate the requested field to store in user config when calling the endpoint

get.description:
Get logs of the webhooks.

By default, it selects logs for the last month. You can use "min_date" and "max_date" to change boundary dates.

parameters.name: id_user
parameters.description: limit number of results to this user

name.description: Name of the bank or provider

hidden.description: This connector is hidden from your users

charged.description: Usage of this connector is charged

beta.description: If true, this connector is perhaps unstable :)

color.description: Main color of the bank or provider

sync_frequency.description: How many days to wait between syncs

months_to_fetch.description: How many months of history to fetch

restricted.description: If true, new connections cannot be added with this connector

fallback.description: Name of the source this fallback is for

disabled.description: This source is not used to synchronize the connection

priority.description: The source priority order for the synchronization

regex.description: If set, the value must match this regexp

type.description: Type of field (text, password, list, hidden)

ephemeral.description: This field will not be saved in database

required.description: If true, field has to be set to synchronize the connection

auth_mechanisms.description: Authentication mechanisms this field is used for

name.description: Name to differentiate the authentication type

type.description: Authentication type to use when pushing the webhook

error.description: If the last update has failed, the error code

error_message.description: If fail, error message received from connector

expire.description: Expiration of the connection. Used during add of a two-factor authentication, to purge the connection if the user abort

active.description: This connection is active and will be automatically synced

id_connector_source.description: ID of the related connector source

disabled.description: This source is not used to synchronize the connection

created.description: Creation date of the connection source

state.description: If the last update has failed, the state code

expire.description: Expiration of the connection source. Used to purge the connection in case completion was not finished

id_source.description: ID of the related connection source

error_uid.description: MD5 hash of the exception backtrace

timestamp.description: Timestamp of log, when the synchronization has finished

next_try.description: If fail, the date represents the next try to connect

error.description: If fail, contains the error code

error_message.description: If fail, error message received from connector

nb_accounts.description: In case of bank connection, number of accounts

start.description: Timestamp when the synchronization has started

fields.description: Fields for connection in additionalInformationNeeded state with background option

updated.description: Date of the webhook last update

add_to_data.description: json object to describe data to add

id_resource.description: a changing ID used to filter webhookdata depending on the event triggered

created.description: Timestamp when the hook data was generated

success.description: Timestamp when the hook has been successfully called

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the hook was sent

response_date.description: Timestamp of the reply to the hook

response_code.description: Return code of the reply to the hook

next_try.description: If the log is an error, do not retry to push before this timestamp

id_parent_category.description: ID of the parent category. If this is a parent category, it will be equal to its own ID

income.description: Is an income category. If null, this is both an income and an expense category

id_parent_category_in_menu.description: ID of the parent category to be displayed

refundable.description: This category accepts opposite sign of transactions

id_user.description: If not null, this category is specific to a user

pro.description: Should the client display the company manager page.

Transfer.description: This is a representation of a transfer.

recipient_iban.description: IBAN of the recipient in bank recipient list

exec_date.description: Date when the transfer will be operated by the bank

register_date.description: Date when the transfer has been registered

state.description: State of the transfer (created, scheduled, validating, pending, coming, done, canceled, transactionNotFound, deleted, error, bug)

error.description: Error message during transfer, if any

account_balance.description: Balance of the account just before the transfer

id_transaction.description: If found, ID of the related transaction

beneficiary_type.description: Type of beneficiary number, for example: 'recipient' (in bank recipient list), 'iban' or 'phone_number'

beneficiary_number.description: Beneficiary bank identifier value like recipient webid, iban: EX6713281847025300290000062 or phone_number: 06XXXXXX

beneficiary_label.description: Label of the beneficiary (needed for transfer to other beneficiary type than 'recipient')

validate_mechanism.description: Authentication method used to validate transfer (credentials or webauth)

id_merchant.description: id of the merchant who initiated the order

id_transfer.description: id of the transfer used to pay this the order

state.description: State of the order (result of the recipient adding and the transfer execution)

error_message.description: more information on the state if something went wrong during the order

opt_out_cause.description: set by the webview, indicates at which step of the payment the user has left the order

last_update.description: Last successful update of the document

has_file_on_website.description: Boolean to set if file is available on website

id.description: ID of the transfer log entry

request_data.description: Data stored related to user who has requested the transfer

state.description: State of the transfer (created, scheduled, validating, pending, done, canceled, error, bug)

error.description: Error message during transfer, if any

fields.description: Fields for transfer in additionalInformationNeeded state with background option

application_date.description: Date considered by PFM services. It is used to change the month of a transaction, for example.

date_scraped.description: Date when the transaction has been seen

bdate.description: Date used by the bank for the transaction

coming.description: If true, this transaction hasn't been yet debited

active.description: If false, PFM services will ignore this transaction

id_cluster.description: If the transaction is part of a cluster

deleted.description: If set, this transaction has been removed from the bank

original_gross_value.description: Gross value in the original currency

card.description: Card number associated to the transaction

original_unitvalue.description: Value on this date, in the original currency

deleted.description: If set, this pocket has been removed from the website

id.description: ID of the transfer log entry

request_data.description: Data stored related to user who has requested the recipient addition

step.description: Step of recipient addition, (add_recipient, asking_field, recipient addition validated, creation, storing_files)

error.description: Error message during recipient addition, if any

fields.description: Fields for recipient in additionalInformationNeeded state with background option

nb_docs.description: Number of docs on the subscription

id_connection_log.description: ID of the related connection log

error.description: If fail, contains the error code

error_message.description: If fail, error message received from provider

id_source.description: ID of the related connection source

UserAlert.description:
/!\ Careful we use default value from database if present

    For more information see AlertsPlugin.init

source.description: Source of the ISIN code (website, notFound)

prev_vdate.description: Value date of the previous value (prev_diff)

original_unitvalue.description: Average buy price in the original currency

original_unitprice.description: Current unit value in the original currency

original_diff.description: Capital gain in the original currency

deleted.description: If set, this investment has been removed from the website

id_target_account.description: ID of the target account, in case of internal recipient

category.description: Category in which the recipient is

last_update.description: Last time we have fetched this recipient

time_scraped.description: First time we've seen this recipient

deleted.description: The recipient isn't found anymore on the bank

enabled_at.description: It will be possible to do transfers to this recipient at this date

fields.description: Fields for recipient with additionalInformationNeeded state

error.description: If fail, contains the error code

error_message.description: If fail, error message received from bank or provider

id_connection_log.description: ID of the related connection log

id_source.description: ID of the related connection source

validity.description: The subscription is valid until this date, if any

last_update.description: Last successful update of the subscription

deleted.description: This subscription is not found on the website anymore

disabled.description: This subscription has been deleted by user and will not be synchronized anymore

error.description: If the last update has failed, the error code

id_source.description: ID of the related connection source

original_name.description: Original name of the account on the bank

coming.description: Amount of coming operations not yet debited

display.description: Display this account in accounts list

last_update.description: Last successful update of the account

deleted.description: This account is not found on the website anymore

disabled.description: This account has been deleted by user and will not be synchronized anymore

bookmarked.description: This account has been bookmarked by user

error.description: If the last update has failed, the error code

ownership.description: Relationship between the credentials owner and the account

company_name.description: Name of the company holding the employee savings of the account

prefix.description: Amount is prefixed or not by the currency

crypto.description: It is a crypto currency or not

datetime.description: Time and date of Market Cap (for cryptos)

type.description: Action done on the config: add, update or delete

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the configuration key was changed
